Ikuti Pasar Global, Harga Emas Antam Anjlok Rp 5.000 per Gram
05 Nov 2019, 03:36 by Antara, Kodrat Setiawan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Harga emas batangan PT Aneka Tambang (Persero) Tbk pada Selasa, 5 November 2019, tercatat Rp 758 ribu per gram atau anjlok Rp 5.000 dibanding hari sebelumnya pada level Rp 763 ribu per gram.
Sementara harga jual kembali (buyback) emas Antam mencapai Rp678.000 per gram, terkoreksi Rp 5.000.
Berdasarkan laman logammulia.com, harga jual emas batangan di gerai Antam seberat 0,5 gram diperdagangkan senilai Rp 403.500, 1 gram Rp 758 ribu, 2 gram Rp 1.465.000, 3 gram Rp 2.176.000, 5 gram Rp 3.610.000, 10 gram Rp 7.155.000, 25 gram Rp 17.780.000, dan 50 gram Rp 35.485.000.
Selanjutnya, harga emas berukuran 100 gram senilai Rp 70.900.000, 250 gram Rp 177.000.000, 500 gram Rp 353.800.000, dan emas seberat 1 kilogram dijual Rp 701.600.000.
Harga jual emas tersebut sudah termasuk pajak penghasilan (PPh) 22 atas emas batangan sebesar 0,45 persen bagi pemegang nomor pokok wajib pajak (NPWP).
Bagi pembeli yang tidak menyertakan NPWP memperoleh potongan pajak lebih tinggi sebesar 0,9 persen.
Sementara itu, harga emas di pasar internasional di divisi COMEX New York Mercantile Exchange lebih rendah pada penutupan perdagangan Senin (Selasa pagi WIB), karena kenaikan ekuitas dan dolar AS yang lebih kuat telah mengurangi permintaan terhadap emas.
Kontrak emas paling aktif untuk pengiriman Desember turun 0,3 dolar AS atau 0,02 persen, menjadi ditutup pada 1.511,1 dolar AS per ounce.
Indeks dolar AS, yang mengukur greenback terhadap enam mata uang utama lainnya, naik 0,24 persen menjadi 97,47 pada pukul 18.30 GMT, sesaat sebelum penyelesaian transaksi emas.
Emas biasanya bergerak berlawanan arah dengan dolar AS, yang berarti jika dolar AS menguat maka emas berjangka akan jatuh, karena emas yang dihargai dalam dolar AS menjadi mahal bagi investor yang menggunakan mata uang lainnya.
Pada pukul 17.35 GMT, Indeks Dow Jones Industrial Average menambahkan 114,75 poin atau 0,42 persen. Indeks S&P 500 naik 11,36 poin atau 0,37 persen, dan Indeks Komposit Nasdaq naik 46,8 poin atau 0,56 persen.
Emas biasanya bergerak berlawanan arah dengan ekuitas AS. Ketika pasar saham sedang meningkat, investor dapat berhenti membeli aset safe haven dan mengalihkan dananya ke aset-aset berisiko seperti saham.
Sedangkan untuk logam mulia lainnya, perak untuk pengiriman Desember naik 1,4 sen atau 0,08 persen, menjadi ditutup pada 18,066 dolar per ounce. Platinum untuk pengiriman Januari turun 15,3 dolar AS atau 1,6 persen, menjadi 938,7 dolar AS per ounce. Pada akhir pekan lalu, emas berjangka berakhir sedikit lebih rendah karena daya tarik safe haven emas tertekan oleh data ekonomi Amerika Serikat yang positif.

Following the Global Market, Antam's Gold Price Drops Rp 5,000 per Gram
05 Nov 2019, 03:36 by Antara, Kodrat Setiawan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The gold price of PT Aneka Tambang (Persero) Tbk on Tuesday, November 5, 2019, was recorded at Rp. 758 thousand per gram or dropped by Rp. 5,000 compared to the previous day at the level of Rp. 763 thousand per gram.
While Antam's gold buyback price reached Rp678,000 per gram, corrected to Rp 5,000.
Based on the logammulia.com page, the selling price of gold bars at Antam outlets weighing 0.5 grams is traded at Rp 403,500, 1 gram at Rp 758 thousand, 2 grams at Rp 1,465,000, 3 grams at Rp 2,176,000, 5 grams at Rp 3,610,000, 10 grams of IDR 7,155,000, 25 grams of IDR 17,780,000, and 50 grams of IDR 35,485,000.
Furthermore, the price of 100 grams of gold worth IDR 70,900,000, 250 grams of IDR 177,000,000, 500 grams of IDR 353,800,000, and 1 kilogram of gold sold for IDR 701,600,000.
The selling price of the gold includes income tax (PPh) 22 for gold bars of 0.45 percent for holders of the taxpayer principal number (NPWP).
For buyers who do not include a tax ID, the tax discount is higher by 0.9 percent.
Meanwhile, the price of gold on the international market in the COMEX division of the New York Mercantile Exchange was lower at the close of trading Monday (Tuesday morning WIB), because an increase in equity and a stronger US dollar has reduced demand for gold.
The most active gold contract for December delivery fell 0.3 dollars, or 0.02 percent, to close at 1,511.1 dollars per ounce.
The US dollar index, which measures the greenback against six other major currencies, rose 0.24 percent to 97.47 at 18:30 GMT, just before the completion of gold transactions.
Gold usually moves in the opposite direction to the US dollar, which means that if the US dollar strengthens, gold futures will fall, because gold which is valued in US dollars becomes expensive for investors using other currencies.
At 17:35 GMT, the Dow Jones Industrial Average added 114.75 points or 0.42 percent. The S&P 500 index rose 11.36 points or 0.37 percent, and the Nasdaq Composite Index rose 46.8 points or 0.56 percent.
Gold usually moves in the opposite direction to US equities. When the stock market is rising, investors can stop buying safe haven assets and divert their funds to risky assets such as stocks.
As for other precious metals, silver for December delivery rose 1.4 cents, or 0.08 percent, to close at 18,066 dollars an ounce. Platinum for January delivery dropped 15.3 dollars, or 1.6 percent, to 938.7 dollars per ounce. At the end of last week, gold futures ended slightly lower as the appeal of safe haven gold was pressured by positive US economic data.
